bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Alternative Names feng zhu 風蛀 , wind bug-attachment.

Pathological Condition of tooth ache brought about by wind-heat, with swollen gums emitting pus. Zhu bing yuan hou lun 諸病源候論 29: 風氣客之，結搏齒間，與血氣相乘，則齦腫。熱氣加之，膿 汁出而臭，侵食齒齦，謂之齲齒，亦曰風齲 , “If wind qi settles there, it will form knottings between the teeth, which are then availed of by blood and qi. As a result, the gums will swell. If heat qi is added, pus will leave, and there is a strong stench. This is called ‘decaying teeth’; another designation is ‘ wind tooth-decay ’”.
